description.zh-cn: 1970年代后期在伊朗王国发生的政变，导致穆罕默德·礼萨·巴列维领导的巴列维王朝被推翻，鲁霍拉·霍梅尼建立了伊朗伊斯兰共和国。
description.en: A series of events in the late 1970s that resulted in the overthrow of the Pahlavi dynasty under Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi and the establishment of the Islamic Republic of Iran led by Ruhollah Khomeini.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗巴列维王朝的末代沙阿（国王），其统治在1979年伊朗伊斯兰革命中被推翻。
description.en: The last Shah (King) of the Pahlavi dynasty of Iran, whose rule was overthrown in the 1979 Iranian Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗什叶派宗教领袖，伊朗伊斯兰革命的领导者，并成为伊朗伊斯兰共和国的第一任最高领袖。
description.en: An Iranian Shia cleric, leader of the Iranian Islamic Revolution, and the first Supreme Leader of the Islamic Republic of Iran.

description.zh-cn: 统治伊朗的最后一个王朝，由礼萨汗建立，被1979年伊斯兰革命推翻。
description.en: The last ruling dynasty of Iran, founded by Reza Khan, which was overthrown by the 1979 Islamic Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 由沙阿穆罕默德-礼萨·巴列维推行的一系列经济和社会改革，旨在使伊朗现代化，但同时也引发了包括霍梅尼在内的宗教势力的反对。
description.en: A series of economic and social reforms launched by Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi to modernize Iran, which also drew opposition from religious figures including Khomeini.

description.zh-cn: 在1979年伊斯兰革命后建立的政教合一共和国。
description.en: A theocratic republic established after the 1979 Islamic Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 由于伊朗伊斯兰革命导致石油产量下降而引发的全球石油危机。
description.en: A global oil crisis caused by a drop in oil production due to the Iranian Islamic Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗激进学生占领美国驻德黑兰大使馆，扣押美国外交官作为人质的事件，持续了444天。
description.en: An event where radical Iranian students seized the U.S. Embassy in Tehran and held American diplomats hostage for 444 days.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗和伊拉克之间的一场长达八年的武装冲突，部分由伊朗伊斯兰革命后试图输出革命引发。
description.en: An eight-year armed conflict between Iran and Iraq, partly triggered by Iran's attempts to export its revolution.

description.zh-cn: 巴列维王朝统治下的伊朗国号，在伊斯兰革命中被推翻。
description.en: The official name of Iran under the Pahlavi dynasty, overthrown in the Islamic Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 巴列维王朝时期的伊朗国家情报和安全组织，以严刑拷打和镇压异己而闻名。
description.en: The national intelligence and security organization of Iran during the Pahlavi dynasty, known for torture and suppression of dissent.

description.zh-cn: 由霍梅尼在伊斯兰革命期间成立的机构，旨在管理国家并为建立新政府做准备。
description.en: A body formed by Khomeini during the Islamic Revolution to manage the country and prepare for the establishment of a new government.

description.zh-cn: 在伊斯兰革命后成立的第一个政府，由迈赫迪·巴扎尔甘领导。
description.en: The first government established after the Islamic Revolution, led by Mehdi Bazargan.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗学者、活动家，伊斯兰革命后被霍梅尼任命为伊朗第一任总理。
description.en: An Iranian scholar and activist who was appointed as the first prime minister of Iran after the Islamic Revolution by Khomeini.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗政治家，巴列维王朝的最后一任总理。
description.en: An Iranian politician who served as the last Prime Minister under the Pahlavi dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 巴列维王朝的创立者，穆罕默德-礼萨·巴列维的父亲。
description.en: The founder of the Pahlavi dynasty and the father of Mohammad Reza Pahlavi.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗政治家，曾任伊朗总理，在1953年被英美策划的政变推翻。
description.en: An Iranian politician who served as Prime Minister of Iran and was overthrown in the 1953 coup d'état orchestrated by the UK and the US.

description.zh-cn: 由英美情报机构策划的推翻伊朗总理穆罕默德·摩萨台政府的政变。
description.en: A coup d'état orchestrated by British and American intelligence agencies to overthrow the government of Prime Minister Mohammad Mosaddegh.

description.zh-cn: 世界强国，在伊斯兰革命前支持巴列维政权，革命后与伊朗关系恶化。
description.en: A world power that supported the Pahlavi regime before the Islamic Revolution and whose relations with Iran deteriorated afterward.

description.zh-cn: 曾对伊朗有重要影响力的欧洲国家，参与了1953年政变。
description.en: A European country with significant historical influence in Iran, involved in the 1953 coup.

description.zh-cn: 由霍梅尼阐述的什叶派政治理论，主张在伊玛目隐遁期间，国家应由最具资格的伊斯兰教法学家（法基赫）监护和统治。该理论是伊朗伊斯兰共和国的宪法基础。
description.en: A Shia political theory elaborated by Khomeini, which holds that during the occultation of the Imam, the state should be governed under the guardianship of the most qualified Islamic jurist (Faqih). It is the constitutional basis of the Islamic Republic of Iran.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗德黑兰的一家日报，其在1978年发表的一篇社论被认为是伊斯兰革命的导火索之一。
description.en: A Tehran-based daily newspaper in Iran, an editorial published in 1978 is considered one of the triggers of the Islamic Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗的什叶派圣城，是革命早期抗议活动的重要地点。
description.en: A holy city for Shia Islam in Iran, and a key site of early protests during the revolution.

description.zh-cn: 发生在伊朗阿巴丹的一场电影院纵火案，造成大量平民死亡。当时许多人归咎于萨瓦克，事件极大地激化了反政府情绪。
description.en: An arson attack on a cinema in Abadan, Iran, that killed many civilians. It was widely blamed on SAVAK at the time and greatly intensified anti-government sentiment.

description.zh-cn: 沙阿的军队在德黑兰贾勒广场向示威者开火，造成大量人员伤亡，此事件使政府与反对派的和解希望彻底破灭。
description.en: The shooting of demonstrators by the Shah's army in Jaleh Square, Tehran, resulting in numerous casualties. This event destroyed any hope of reconciliation between the government and the opposition.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰革命时期的美国总统，其政府对人权问题的强调鼓舞了伊朗反对派。
description.en: The President of the United States during the Islamic Revolution, whose administration's emphasis on human rights encouraged the Iranian opposition.

description.zh-cn: 伊拉克前总统，于1980年发动入侵伊朗，引发两伊战争。
description.en: Former President of Iraq who launched an invasion of Iran in 1980, starting the Iran-Iraq War.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗的共产主义政党，在革命初期支持霍梅尼，后遭到镇压。
description.en: A communist party in Iran that initially supported Khomeini but was later suppressed.

description.zh-cn: 一个结合了伊斯兰教和马克思主义思想的伊朗左翼武装反对派组织。
description.en: An Iranian left-wing armed opposition group that combines Islamic and Marxist ideologies.

nodes.id: 伊朗人民敢死游击队组织

zh-cn: 伊朗人民敢死游击队组织
en: Organization of Iranian People's Fedai Guerrillas

description.zh-cn: 伊朗的马克思列宁主义游击队组织，在革命后与伊斯兰政府对立。
description.en: A Marxist-Leninist guerrilla organization in Iran that opposed the Islamic government after the revolution.

description.zh-cn: 由霍梅尼成立的一支独立于常规军队的军事力量，旨在捍卫伊斯兰革命和政权。
description.en: A branch of Iran's armed forces, founded by Khomeini, independent of the regular army, intended to protect the Islamic Revolution and the regime.

description.zh-cn: 在伊朗伊斯兰革命后，为了使教育系统伊斯兰化并清除西方和非伊斯兰影响而发起的运动。
description.en: A movement following the Iranian Revolution to Islamize the education system and purge Western and non-Islamic influences.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗的邻国，在萨达姆·侯赛因的领导下于1980年入侵伊朗，引发两伊战争。
description.en: A neighboring country to Iran, which under Saddam Hussein's leadership invaded Iran in 1980, starting the Iran-Iraq War.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗伊斯兰革命推翻了巴列维王朝的统治。
description.en: The Iranian Islamic Revolution overthrew the rule of the Pahlavi dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗伊斯兰革命导致了伊朗伊斯兰共和国的建立。
description.en: The Iranian Islamic Revolution led to the establishment of the Islamic Republic of Iran.

description.zh-cn: 作为宗教及革命领袖，霍梅尼领导了伊朗伊斯兰革命。
description.en: As a religious and revolutionary leader, Khomeini led the Iranian Islamic Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰革命迫使沙阿穆罕默德-礼萨·巴列维流亡海外。
description.en: The Islamic Revolution forced Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi into exile.

description.zh-cn: 革命成功后，霍梅尼成为伊朗的最高领袖。
description.en: After the success of the revolution, Khomeini became the Supreme Leader of Iran.

description.zh-cn: 沙阿穆罕默德-礼萨·巴列维推行了白色革命，进行了一系列现代化改革。
description.en: Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi initiated the White Revolution, a series of modernization reforms.

description.zh-cn: 霍梅尼公开批评白色革命，认为其损害了伊斯兰教和国家利益，成为反对派领袖。
description.en: Khomeini publicly criticized the White Revolution, believing it undermined Islam and national interests, and became a leader of the opposition.

description.zh-cn: 因批评沙阿，霍梅尼被巴列维政权逮捕并驱逐出境。
description.en: For criticizing the Shah, Khomeini was arrested and exiled by the Pahlavi regime.

description.zh-cn: 美国与英国共同策划了1953年伊朗政变，推翻了摩萨台政府。
description.en: The United States, along with the United Kingdom, orchestrated the 1953 Iranian coup to overthrow the Mosaddegh government.

description.zh-cn: 英国与美国共同策划了1953年伊朗政变，推翻了摩萨台政府。
description.en: The United Kingdom, along with the United States, orchestrated the 1953 Iranian coup to overthrow the Mosaddegh government.

description.zh-cn: 1953年的政变推翻了总理穆罕默德·摩萨台的政府。
description.en: The 1953 coup d'état overthrew the government of Prime Minister Mohammad Mosaddegh.

description.zh-cn: 政变成功后，沙阿穆罕默德-礼萨·巴列维得以复位并巩固其权力。
description.en: After the successful coup, Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi was reinstated and consolidated his power.

description.zh-cn: 礼萨汗自立为沙阿，建立了巴列维王朝。
description.en: Reza Shah established himself as Shah and founded the Pahlavi dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 穆罕默德-礼萨·巴列维是礼萨汗的儿子。
description.en: Mohammad Reza Pahlavi was the son of Reza Shah.

description.zh-cn: 《消息报》发表的一篇中伤霍梅尼的社论文章，引发了库姆的抗议活动，标志着伊斯兰革命的开端。
description.en: An editorial in Ettela'at newspaper denigrating Khomeini sparked protests in Qom, marking the beginning of the Islamic Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 雷克斯戏院大火被许多人归咎于萨瓦克，极大地激化了反政府情绪，推动了革命的发展。
description.en: The Cinema Rex fire, widely blamed on SAVAK, greatly intensified anti-government sentiment and fueled the revolution.

description.zh-cn: 军队对示威者的屠杀事件使政府与反对派彻底失去和解机会，进一步推动了革命。
description.en: The massacre of demonstrators by the army destroyed any chance of reconciliation between the government and the opposition, further propelling the revolution.

description.zh-cn: 在伊朗伊斯兰革命期间，伊朗王国与伊斯兰革命委员会是冲突的两个主要对立方。
description.en: During the Iranian Islamic Revolution, the Kingdom of Iran and the Islamic Revolutionary Council were the two main opposing sides.

description.zh-cn: 革命期间，伊朗石油产业的罢工导致石油产量锐减，引发了第二次石油危机。
description.en: During the revolution, strikes in Iran's oil industry led to a sharp decline in oil production, triggering the Second Oil Crisis.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰革命后伊朗试图输出革命，被伊拉克视为威胁，是两伊战争爆发的原因之一。
description.en: After the Islamic Revolution, Iran's attempt to export the revolution was seen as a threat by Iraq, becoming one of the causes of the Iran-Iraq War.

description.zh-cn: 伊拉克总统萨达姆·侯赛因认为伊朗革命后局势混乱，是推翻神权政府和重夺领土的机会，因此挥军入侵伊朗，发动了两伊战争。
description.en: Iraqi President Saddam Hussein saw the post-revolutionary chaos in Iran as an opportunity to overthrow the theocratic government and reclaim territory, leading him to invade Iran and start the Iran-Iraq War.

description.zh-cn: 伊拉克与伊朗在1980年至1988年间进行了两伊战争。
description.en: Iraq and Iran were engaged in the Iran-Iraq War from 1980 to 1988.

description.zh-cn: 因抗议霍梅尼对人质危机的处理方式，总理迈赫迪·巴扎尔甘及其内阁辞职。
description.en: Prime Minister Mehdi Bazargan and his cabinet resigned in protest of Khomeini's handling of the hostage crisis.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗人质危机导致美国与伊朗的外交关系中断。
description.en: The Iran hostage crisis led to the severing of diplomatic relations between the United States and Iran.

description.zh-cn: 霍梅尼成立了伊斯兰革命卫队，作为捍卫伊斯兰革命的意识形态和军事力量。
description.en: Khomeini founded the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps as an ideological and military force to defend the Islamic Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗人民党在革命初期支持新政权，但在1983年因被指控为苏联从事间谍活动而遭到取缔。
description.en: The Tudeh Party supported the new regime in the early stages of the revolution but was banned in 1983 after being accused of spying for the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 伊朗人民圣战者组织在1981年与神权政府摊牌，遭到镇压后成为主要的反对派武装力量。
description.en: The People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran had a showdown with the theocratic government in 1981 and, after being suppressed, became a major armed opposition force.

description.zh-cn: 文化革命旨在使伊朗的大学和教育系统伊斯兰化，以巩固伊斯兰共和国的意识形态基础。
description.en: The Cultural Revolution aimed to Islamize Iran's universities and education system to consolidate the ideological foundation of the Islamic Republic.
